venue.address_1: Just south of the Highland Center
venue.name: Crawford Depot

item.description:
Meet us at the Crawford Depot for a hike to Mt Pierce and Mt Eisenhower.

Starting along the Crawford Path we ascend 2354 feet to Mt. Pierce ( 4,310'ft). From Pierce we continue along the Crawford Path and hit Mt. Eisenhower (4,780'ft), via the Eisenhower loop trail. From Eisenhower we work our way back to the Crawford Path

Going over both summits the hike is rated as moderate. (rt: 9.6 miles, 3,250 feet, 6:25 book time- we will add time for an easier pace and photos.


Hiking in and out the same trail will give some of our hikers an option of a shorter hike as long as they remain in a group. Once we reach Mt Pierce this is an exposed hike in the alpine zone and hopefully plenty of views.  The Crawford Paths is gentle, and is probably the "easiest" trip with a lot of time spent above treeline.

Early weather prediction is  Mostly cloudy. High of 45F. Winds from the WNW at 5 to 15 mph. We will update this as the week progresses.

What can we expect? With temps above and below 32 degrees, the trail will be pitted with boot marks, sticky snow, possible post holes, ice and bare rock.  mud at lower levels (leg gaiters helpful). Continue to pack winter layers! I find this time of year to be most dangerous for misjudging what to pack.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the at the yellow depot next to the Crawford Center or suggest a carpool in your comments- we average $40 a trip in gas- so carpooling is advisable.
item.name: Let's Hike...... Mt Eisenhower and Pierce 2 4K's
